name: Country Music Trivia 2 Quiz | Country Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which of the following statements is true in regards to the song "Unbreakable Heart" which has been recorded by
Carlene Carter and Jessica Andrews?
questions.correct: It was written by a Heartbreaker.
options: Carlene Carter is the Aunt of Jessica Andrews
It was the first song ever to hit the charts in two different version
Both versions were released during the same year.
questions.explanation:
It was written by a Heartbreaker.

	Yes, it was written by a real heartbreaker. The song was written by Benmont Tench who besides writing songs is a memberof the group Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers, and he is one of the Heartbreakers.  Many songs have hit the charts in more then one version.Carlene Carter is not related to Jessica Andrews, although Carlene comes from a family of stars. Her mother in June Carter Cash, her fatheris Carl Smith, her Step-Father is Johnny Cash and her Step-Sister is Roseanne Cash.  She was always once married to rocker Nick Lowe. Carlene's version can be found on her album "Little Love Letter" and Jessica's version can be found on her album "Heart Shaped World."

questions.text: Who the artist that sang the following lyrics: "blame it on your lyin', cheatin', cold dead beatin', two timin', double dealin', mean mistreatin', lovin' heart"?
questions.explanation:
Patty Loveless.

	The lyrics are from Patty Loveless' song "Blame It On Your Heart" which was released in 1993 and was included on her album "Only What I Feel".

questions.text: Who sings the following line:  "I've got a Mustang, it'll do 80"?
questions.explanation:
Martina McBride.

	The line is taken from the song "When God-Fearing Women Get The Blues" which can be found on Martina's "Greatest Hits" album.  Martina was named the CMA's Female Vocalist of the Year for 2002.

questions.text: In the Randy Travis song "Three Wooden Crosses", which of the characters in the song survived the bus crash?
questions.explanation:
The Hooker.

	The end of the song has the following line, "the preacher gave this bible to my momma, who read it to me".  This song can be found on Randy's "Rise & Shine" album.

questions.text: According to a Trace Adkins song, what is her favorite color?
questions.explanation:
Chrome.

	Trace stands a towering 6 foot 6 inches.  Before starting his recording career he was an oilfield roughneck.  Other songs by Trace include "(This Ain't) No Thinking Thing" and "Every Light In The House".

questions.text: What was the first song to hit number 1 on the "Billboard Country Chart" in the 1980's
options: Does Fort Worth Ever Cross Your Mind
I Think I'll Just Stay Here And Drink
questions.explanation:
Coward of the County.

	Kenny Rogers spent 3 weeks at the top of the charts staring on January 5, 1980. He began singing with his high school band The Scholars then became the bass players in a jazz group called The Bobby Doyle Trio.  Next up were stints in Kirby STone Four and the New Christy Minstrels. Then came the First Edition where Kenny Rogers had his first chart success with "Ruby, Don't Take Your Love to Town."

questions.text: Which artists had a song on the "Billboard Country Charts" every week from 1982 through 2002?
questions.explanation:
George Strait.

	Actually his streak began in June 1981 and is still going strong. His first song to hit the charts was "Unwouund" and a week hasn't gone by without a George Strait song being on the charts.  He dabbled in the movies with the starring role in "Pure Country."

questions.text: What group was Larry Stewart in before going solo and having a top 5 hit with "Alright Already"?
questions.explanation:
Restless Heart.

	Restless Heart recorded such songs as "I'll Still Be Loving You", "Bluest Eyes in Texas", "A Tender Lie", and "You Can Depend On Me."

questions.text: Which of the following artists was Lorrie Morgan NOT married to?
questions.explanation:
Gary Morris.

	Lorrie recorded at least one duet with each of these husbands: "'Til A Tear Becomes a Rose" with Keith Whitley, "By My Side" with Jon Randall, and "I Finally Found Someone" with Sammy Kershaw.

questions.text: Which of the following did not have a relative who also has a chart hit?
questions.explanation:
Suzy Bogguss.

	Dottie West's daughter Shelly West hit with songs such as "You're the Reason God Make Oklahoma" and "Jose Cuervo.  Crystal Gayle's sister is Country Legend Loretta Lynn.  Reba's brother Pake has such hits as "Every Night" and "Savi' My Love for You."
